The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: To entertain a guest, that with which a guest is entertained. To collect, run to/into. To explore; investigate; with a much and diligent search, city/town.
data.sentence: The word قَرْيَةٍ comes from the root ق ر ي and is associated with the meanings: To entertain a guest, that with which a guest is entertained. To collect, run to/into. To explore; investigate; with a much and diligent search, city/town.

data.meanings: to die, perish, wasted, be lost, destroyed, spoiled.
data.sentence: The word أَهْلَكْنَا comes from the root ه ل ك and is associated with the meanings: to die, perish, wasted, be lost, destroyed, spoiled.

data.meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.
data.sentence: The word مُنْذِرُونَ comes from the root ن ذ ر and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.
